intro: Digitaria natalensis subsp. stentiana, commonly known as Natal fingergrass, is a perennial grass species native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its tufted growth habit and narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear numerous tiny florets. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in grasslands and disturbed areas. Its botanical features make it adaptable to various environmental conditions.
